name: peterjoel
text:
title is semantically more correct.

In HTML, the alt attribute for an image is intended to be a one-line description that conveys the meaning of the image, for user agents that cannot display the image (or for users who cannot see it). So if there was a picture of a large shipment of cod, the alt attribute would probably read "A large shipment of cod". For an achewood strip, this would probably have to be the entire transcript. I think most people would have to agree though that, all things considered, if your eyesight isn't good enough to read the cartoon, you might just have to live with the fact that you won't enjoy it as much as other people.

On the other hand, the title attribute is intended to summarize the content of the image, possibly adding additional information than could be interpreted from the image itself. In the case of a cod shipment, the title attribute might read "Ray's shipment". The contents of the title do not need to be able to completely replace the image.

Achewood's title text doesn't quite fit the criteria for the intent of the attribute but it's a better fit than alt . HTML5 is probably going to include a child tag for images, which would probably be even more appropriate.

I had assumed that this strip was in some way a reference to some concerns around this area.

On a related note... I have a pet peeve about people referring to them as "alt tags". They are attributes (which maybe applied to various tags).

name: wilto
text:
This Asset Is Valid TRUTH [Strict]!

This means that the resource in question identified itself as "awesome" and that we successfully performed a formal validation using an CHUBBIES or XML Parser (depending on the markup language used).

name: tekende
text: wilto, you've just won a brand new virtual chubby!

name: tellumo
text: It is exactly so. I would only write separately to add that when webcomics began experimenting with popup/tooltip/supplementary text, the TITLE attribute to the IMG tag either didn't exist or was very ill-supported, so they used ALT, and "alt text" came to be the colloquialism for such popups.

name: achilleselbow
text:
Ray must not have been there very long, otherwise his letter would have read something like this:

~~Deareft Beef~~

Much as it pains my heart to difrupt this most facred of Cod Fridays with an epiftle bearing ill tidings, the prefent circumstanfes brook no hefitation. I fear I have been remifs in certain matters of hearth and home prior to my much-deferved departure, and muft now afk you to attend to them in my abfence:

1. The moving pictures I have received through the carrier fervice muft need be returned within a fortnight.

2. It is much defired that the kitchen refufe be removed from the houfe left it begin to emanate an odour moft foul and thereby atract all manner of beafts and vermin into the vicinity.

3. I had quite forgotten to difable the automatic timekeeping device on the contraption in which my Turkish roaft is brewed. Various cleaning accouterments may be found in the linen clofet.

4. Laftly, I fear that you and Molly shall have to read by candlelight for the next month and your feafonal deprefsion lamp muft needs go unufed. You have my utmoft apologies for this inconvenience.

Your humble friend in undying gratitude and all imputations thereof,

~~Raymond Quentin Smuckleworth III

name: achilleselbow
text: No, that's actually an f. I mean if assetbar (or afsetbar, if you prefer) won't even let you use plus signs, I wasn't about to try to encode special characters on there. So I used f's instead of the long s where required. But a long s would only be used at the beginning or middle of a word, never at the end.

text: A comment left by aikennubbles was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, Thorfinn, goocifer, Flyffe, DrSkradley, biff)

name: farqussus
text: exactly what accent is that? It sounds like Elmer Fudd in my head. Is Elmer Fudd particularly vociferous about stroke weight?

name: bjorntd
text: I extracted Tweety Bird from that diction.

name: aikennubbles
text: That is actually your accent.  The last time I heard it was many years ago, whining %u201CDaddy don%u2019t weeve us!%u201D  Now you know.  I%u2019m your father.  And I don%u2019t love you.

name: aikennubbles
text: Shit.  My riposte got garbled.  Figure it out

name: bjorntd
text:
That's the internet telling you to stop being a cock.

Cut that shit out.

name: featurelessvoid
text: And to a stranger, no less!

name: farqussus
text: Your riposte needs a repost. Puns are better than you!

name: aikennubbles
text: I'll give you the executive summary: I fathered each one of you, and left your slatternly mothers to raise you alone.  Also I slapped rowboat a good one before I left.

name: rowboat
text:
Quote:
Also I slapped rowboat a good one before I left.

That would explain my trouble with basic math.

Thanks, pops.

name: usversusthem
text: It could just be AssetBar's fault, you know.

name: rowboat
text: God, that was embarrassing. Being a cock is OK, but you have to be decent at it.

name: drskradley
text: Well said.  If only I weren't too friendly, kamerade, if only I weren't too friendly.

name: ibetso
text: Could be something to do with this troublesome laptop he's using abroad

name: professorhazard
text: If there's one thing a man doesn't want analyzed, it's the weight of his stroke. Have some class, barrylegg.

name: pzukowski
text: A comment left by pzukowski was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Dovey, NeoNaoNeo, synnah, farqussus)

name: professorhazard
text: What'd I just say about class, man.

name: l_c_b
text: That is a pretty fair drawing of a humble cottage. It is like the residence of a mildly insane hermit you would see built near a cliff, or a poacher's hut located in a forest.

name: spectre
text: Did he do a house swap with a mildly insane hermit? Is there a mildly insane English hermit in Achewood Estates now, across the street from the latin GOF winner guy? Is this the movie that I saw last year? Yes, it was a chick flick. But I will see any movie with Kate Winslet if there is any slight chance she will remove clothing. (If she doesn't, I just rent ART SCHOOL CONFIDENTIAL again.) We need to see the Hermit.

name: professorhazard
text: I find it odd that Envelope Martinez would have plastic surgery to hide the fact that he lost a fight to Ray Smuckles, but not move away from his place of residence at that time. Seems like an unskilled method of disguising one's shame.

name: dovey
text: I think Envelopeeeee was using Raaaay as an excuse for some surgeryyyyyyy

name: straw
text: Well, that's what it ended up being anyway.  Ain't no shame in being beat by SOR.

name: usversusthem
text:
I believe the correct nomenclature is "So-Rod."

Anyway it sounds cooler.

name: tetsujin
text:
Did he follow through with that? I think the shame would be lessened somewhat by the fact that Ray actually won the fight...

Big difference between losing a fight to some pampered, flabby chump, and losing a fight to a pampered, flabby GOF champion...

name: dovey
text: Nah, he just got chica eyebrows and a bathroom dye-job instead.

name: tekende
text:
I actually kind of liked that movie. A little bit. I mean, you know. Jack Black. Jude Law. The aforementioned Kate Winslet. There are things to like in that movie.

Cameron Diaz is not one of them.

name: andyfaewatford
text: There's a song about that film by the band The Wombats, called 'Kill The Director'. The chorus goes something along the lines of 'This is no Bridget Jones...' On the strength of hat review I have not been tempted to see it.

name: andyfaewatford
text: That's right, Hat Review- for all your hat reviewing needs!

name: tekende
text: Wait. You're basing your movie-going decisions on a band who likes Bridget Jones?

name: andyfaewatford
text: Well, not really, but if a film is described as worse than Bridget Jones, then I feel that film is best avoided...

name: pityparty
text: It is a chickflick-bashing song, methinks

name: pityparty
text: (but then again The Wombats is the band who told us to dance to Joy Division so they being ironically into Bridget Jones is not really impossible)

name: dovey
text:
The Wombats don't got no ding dang idea about what they like, they're so caught up in that whole "irony" thing.

Fie on them, I say!

name: spectre
text:
There was no significant removal of clothes, though Kate did wear a bikini in the pool. It was thin broth, but it served.
I would do Kate before I did Scarlett Johansson.

name: peterjoel
text:
Whenever I do Scarlett Johansson, I always insist on doing Kate Winslet first.

It took a while, but she's pretty comfortable with the idea these days.

name: tekende
text: I would not hesitate for one second to do Scarlet Johansson. I would do her before I'd do my own girlfriend.

name: thorfinn
text: Cameron Diaz is definitely one of them.  I would hit that like an angry god.

name: tekende
text:
Gross, man.

Okay, back when, like, The Mask came out? Yeah, sure. Totally. But now? Nuh-uh. You'd have to pay me to do her. She has not aged well at all. Hella bad skin and saggy parts.

name: rowboat
text: All ya'll would do anything that'd let ya. Forget about it.

name: dovey
text: Wait how is Jude Law a thing to like

name: tekende
text:
Have you seen Road to Perdition ? If not, go see it.

Jude Law is a good actor. He just takes roles in stupid movies a lot.

name: dovey
text:
Yes, I have seen that movie!

It was a good film, and Jude Law was a good actor in it. Thankyou for the reminder.

name: l_c_b
text: Also note he signed his letter that way because he thinks that is how one does these things in England. I'm surprised he didn't sign it off with a "cheerio". or "cheerio my dogg"

name: echidnaboy
text:
I remain, sincerely, your most humble D.O.G.G.,
-=Ray=-

name: a-halter
text: This is a truly exceptional strip, Mr. Onstad, and I would be remiss should I fail to applaud you.  Three cheers for the heavenly scribe and cartoonist, three cheers!  (p.s. this is my first posting on the website, and though I am skeptical of whether you'd read this or not, I think I'll post more comments on some of my favorite strips in case you do.)  This strip has marvelous scene-setting and really top-notch artistry as well as a hilarious joke that carves even more character out of the increasingly complicated friendship (brotherhood/marriage?) of Ray and Roast Beef.

name: farqussus
text: i like hut

name: ibetso
text: I like lamp

name: woodenteeth
text: A comment left by woodenteeth was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by NeoNaoNeo, cavebaby, farqussus)

name: tekende
text: i heard u liek mudkips

name: achilleselbow
text: do u like whoper

name: tekende
text: come on dude do u like 2 eat pizza

name: bjorntd
text: *thoughtfully fingers first Onion Offense (tm)*

name: cailetshadow
text:
wow. This little reply cascade is like a core sample of the internet itself.

Note how the thin crust of an actual post floats lightly over a dense mantle of semisolid references and half-ironic jargon. It's beautiful, in a way.

name: dovey
text: As long as the Internet still has posts like yours, I'm willing to put up with the other stuff.

name: professorhazard
text: i have had whoper

name: straw
text: How very straightforward.  Not a whiff of irony or sarcasm.  Not even slightly marmy!

name: dovey
text: You know what, you're right! a-halter, have your first chubby for straight-up old-fashioned honesty.

name: drago25
text: Poor Ray. He's the type of cat that just knows everyone should by all rights have hella fun at Disneyland.

name: neonfreon
text: wait, why does he have to return netflix!? NO LATE FEES!

name: saucy_jack
text: He just wants to be a decent guy.

name: straw
text: So he can have all new movies when he gets back.

name: miku224
text: I don't see why. It's just going to be a different copy of Braveheart.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Ooh, the unrated version.

name: ibetso
text: I can see Ray having a special storage cupboard full of Braveheart DVDs, and every time he wants to watch it he takes out a new one. Before every viewing, he peels the cellophane off the new DVD with the help of a knife that he had custom made for the purpose (a minature version of William Wallace's sword, made with platinum and precious stones).

name: professorhazard
text: Now you're thinkin' like a Smuckles.

name: heeeraldo
text: not doing so would deny someone else the chance to watch the films; effectively he'd be being a cock to a stranger.

name: proof_man
text:
"pay power utils on you molly's unit"
does this mean that ray usually pays for beef's utilities?

name: zeal
text: Well, Beef lives at his house.  In the pool house.

name: farqussus
text: What does the acronym D.O.G.G. stand for?

name: biff
text: Dear Old Gracious Gent

name: tekende
text: This is entirely plausible. Well done. You may remove your head from your sphincter.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: Dude Of Great...(something)

name: strix22
text: Dude of Glorified Gentry

name: professorhazard
text:
May I Leave Flowers?

wait

name: streever
text: hey-o!

name: ryabovsky
text: I think that Ray has gone on holiday by mistake.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Rod Huggins shows up in the middle of the night, all with a brandy flip and eye shadow, and laments at how he'll never play the Dane.

name: jimmykey
text: A comment left by jimmykey was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Thorfinn, pzukowski, streever, usversusthem, deblacquiere)

name: professorhazard
text: A comment left by professorhazard was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Thorfinn, NeoNaoNeo, wargasmic, mortshire, Dallovich)

name: professorhazard
text:
I'd feel a lot worse about getting triple-Lamed if it was by anyone I respected or in fact had ever heard of. As it stands, I think most people who enjoy my quippery have raised their Lame threshold to a higher allowance.

In closing, GET A JOB!

name: nickgranger
text: chubbied for your resilience

name: baryonyx
text: My lame count is always at least five digits long. People lame for a vast spread of reasons, the majority inscrutable, and therefore lames indicate absolutely nothing about a post.

name: usversusthem
text: Mine is set to fifty. I like the idea of being able to click on something knowing it's going to be a truly bad post, and then seeing that it is, and feeling content.

name: odei
text: Mine is on 10000000000. I get the director's cut of assetbar.

name: lost_buoy
text: My Assetbar still has the Harrison Ford voiceover.

name: pyromancer
text: I just upped mine from ten to fifty.  I always took the time to go look & come back anyway. Plus the ones that disappear at 50 count, you know will be worth the effort.

name: pzukowski
text: A comment left by pzukowski was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Thorfinn, falseprophet, streever)

name: streever
text:
jimmykey
that is a silly idea
everyone knows you don't make money that way
but you might get a computer virus
why don't you just be a man and mail him 15 bucks, hidden discreetly in a moldy sandwich? (he likes bologne)

name: saucy_jack
text: On the other hand, don't you think that most of us would never even see the ads?

name: nymphadoria
text: Rural England is where most people go for penance type deals, unfortunately...it is Cod Friday that suffers the most.

name: edwell
text: The sky is subtly brown.

name: nickgranger
text: Any idea what D.O.G.G. stands for?

name: nickgranger
text: someone just asked this. i retract

name: senorspoof
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: steerpike66
text: Oh Ray: this is hardly 'Walden', is it?

name: steerpike66
text:
Did Philippe get to go Disneylaaaaand? He was at that special aaaaage!

If he didn't, and Beef did and hated it; it would be a cruel atrocity.

name: streever
text:
dear chris:
thank you for grappling with the flawed laptop
it is appreciated

name: uruloki
text: Achewood Heights gone Wuthering Heights

name: shades
text: this was depressing. Ray doesn't belong in tiny, horrible European homes. he belongs in mansions and Benz's givin ends to his friends cause it feels stupendous

name: rowboat
text:
Your reference reminds me that things could be worse for Ray. He's doin' better than Biggie.

We're all doin' better than Biggie. We should remember that sometimes.

I know Ray does.

name: comrade_tom
text:
Put your hands up for dorchester

Ray loves that county.

name: deblacquiere
text:
It falls to me to speak out in defence of Ray. Beef is being one ungrateful dogg. Or catt.

I have been to Eurodisney, which is in France, which is in Europe, just outside of the US. It must have been nastier than Disneyland, because it was full of overexcited French children (the most vile creatures in all of Europe). But I didn't send my kind and generous hosts to a dank eco-cottage in Devon. I think Beef should sit under his stupid little light until he realises how ungrateful he's been.

name: tekende
text: Virtual chubby.

name: tellumo
text: I dunno, I think Ray may have decided to do this on his own. Beef just would have stewed a bit and drank a little airplane-size bottle of Jäger and let it go.

name: cargoweasel
text: Hey, we haven't seen Beef in his shirt and tie for awhile! Kind of nice to see.

name: pzukowski
text: This is your eye on drugs.

name: drskradley
text: My hypothetical chubbies unto you and your eye-kin.

name: flazisismuss
text: I am looking to spend less money on my European vacation this summer, due to Bush Recession III and the declining value of the US currency.  How much do you all think this cottage would run for about 5 days in July in American pesos, er, dollars?  It looks relaxing and I hear July is one of the two nice months in rural England.

name: deblacquiere
text:
You will pay the equivalent of $2000 a week for a dank little cottage with excess condensation running down the windows, it will be draughty, it will smell, and when you turn the hot tap on, there will be a few bangs and then rusty cold water comes out for the next hour, until you finally get some lukewarm.

The neighbour will come round and sit on the damp sofa with you and go on and on endlessly about the bloody Post Office closing down. You'll go on a day trip to Wookie Hole, but be totally disappointed and argue in the car about how you are meant to go round a roundabout. It will rain, you will be miserable, and you will pay a great deal of money. That's England.

Just go to Peru instead, you'll probably see less teenage pregnancy.

name: flazisismuss
text: That doesn't sound fun at all.  I think I'd rather go to Baja.  The weather is nice and everything is legal.

name: achilleselbow
text: The way the letter is written makes it look like Ray forgot to pay the power and utilities for Beef, as well as the power and utilities for Molly's unit. This is quite unfortunate, as "Molly's unit" sounds like the name of a film that Lyle would rent.

name: jay-are
text: This strip is alien to me... Cod Friday? Whatever happened the Cod Wednesday I'm so familiar with?

name: saucy_jack
text: It was changed due to shipping challenges.

name: jargonmaster
text:
I have a feeling he's talking about Good Friday - Ray is Catholic, right?

Personally i'm all geared up for a trip down to the cove to gruffle mad fish 'n chips

name: tekende
text: But Good Friday isn't until NEXT week.

name: soupkaty
text:
Your comment made me remember that it's lent right now, something i've forgotten the past 32 days.
I am an awful catholic :(

name: ibetso
text: I fell obliged to let you know that I'm reporting you to the Pope.

name: dovey
text: You goddamn snitch David.

name: achewood
text: Ray is a Good Friend.

name: obliviator
text: I would like to see moor strips like this one today.

name: loneal
text: Ray as penitent Othello, Beef as Brabantio, who saw this all coming. Cornelius could be Cassio or something, I guess.

name: miku224
text: CHUBBIED.

name: straw
text: That is just outstanding comment-icon synchronicity.  Just superb.

name: drskradley
text:
A picture of the combo should be an award for something. Anything. It could replace the Congressional Medal of Honor, the Iron Cross, the Hero of the Soviet Union, the Order of the Golden Kite, and the Military Order of Mother Theresa. Oh yes, that one's real.

Aw crap - it was Maria Theresa. That's not half as funny.

name: dovey
text:
The Emphatic Chubby of the Psychaneon Danceasaur.

You may attach EmCPsD to the end of your name, loneal.

name: tellumo
text: That could be good, but I think he was talking about how Ray's cottage is in an uncultivated upland covered in low-growing vegetation .

name: envika
text: is it just me, or is all of acheworld subtly pissed off today?

name: catgrl131
text: Hey, you're the one making the mean face at me!

name: daidai
text:
I think its a happy face with a two-part mustache and oddly plucked eyebrows.

But I'm an optimist.

name: loneal
text: Judging by envika's status, I would say that face is "'gasming."

name: tekende
text: That looks like a 'gasm I wouldn't want.

name: thorfinn
text: It looked kinda like one of those "Mr. Yuck" stickers that used to be popular to put on cleaners and other items that parents didn't want their children to drink.

name: tekende
text: [IMGS OFF]

text: Calvin and Hobbes! High five! Deja vu!

name: tekende
text: Oh man this is wackyyyyyy

name: envika
text: chubbied for correctness

name: bjorntd
text: FUUUUUUUUUUUCK YOOOOOOOOOOU.

name: drskradley
text: Seeing a little dude in a boat with such unobstructed anger makes me happy in a sad way.

name: qingofchina
text: Deep Thoughts: with Ray Smuckles

name: clever-nickname
text: The fact that D.O.G.G. is an acronym for something and Ray put pound signs around the "R" instead of dollar signs put the score up to a 5

name: envika
text: Just because "D.O.G.G." is in all capitals and has a period after each letter doesn't necessarily make it an acronym... ( cf. K.L.I.T.Z. - B. - R.E.D.D.Y.?)

name: tellumo
text: Virtual chubby for the underused [i]cf.[i] signal.

name: tellumo
text:
cf.

curse you assetbar!!!! curse you!!!!!!

name: tekende
text: That was clearly your own fault. Don't go blaming Assetbar for your backslash-related failures.

name: latterman
text:
Ray's window has a cross frame in the 4th panel, and none in the 5th.

What is the literary meaning of this?

name: odei
text: "Whoops!"

name: flazisismuss
text: He opened the window.

name: jbushnell
text: A No-Prize for you!

name: latterman
text: Doesn't look like an open window, of which I've seen many in my travels.

name: bjorntd
text: It means you've been hella klondike, man.

name: sortelli
text: You guys have really outdone yourself with the sheer number of stupid posts today.  By an order of magnitude.

name: wittyname
text: Agreed, simply because of the sheer amounts of posts dedicated towards the alt text. Not the actual words, but how to properly view it. Seriously, once it's said there isn't anything more to say.

name: amadaun
text: This strip hurts me inside. It's neither poignant nor funny. The best part is the alt next, and that only elicited the mildest of chuckles.

name: autrepoupee
text: but, Ray feels so bad about such a minor offense as a friend not having the grandest ol' time while on a vacation that he feels he needs to punish himself by chilling for awhile in an Olde Englishe Cottagee. Yet he is still concerned for the status of his Netflix, so he's not really feeling as bad as he'd have you believe.  I think it's worth a smirk and a winsome sigh!

name: wittyname
text: No.

name: chuvak
text: why don't you cry like a bitch about it?

name: drskradley
text: A question all should ask at some point.

name: dovey
text: I choose to Weep the Weepy-Weep Way.

name: skoora
text: It is my secret dream to live in a place like that. No lights, no people, just the sound of the English wind coming through the windows and the smell of untamed grass it brings with it.

name: drskradley
text:
This strip is not a good example of this, but do you ever think that Onstad reads our conversations, and adjusts his creative tendencies accordingly?

I certainly hope not. It would be a fool's journey. The general populace is fickle and stupid.

name: drskradley
text:
>Thou art in Onstad's creative centre of the mind. Thou see Ray, Beef, Teodor, Philippe and all thy Achewood crew. Assetbar is to the West. There exits to the North, South, East, and Dennis. What wouldst thou deau?
Get Achewood crew.
>Thou already hast Achewood crew. It is in thy head.
You just said I didn't. You just said I could see them.
>I do not understand thy request.
Use Achewood crew.
>How wouldst thou use Achewood crew?
Give Achewood crew to Assetbar.
>It is a fool's journey.


I know, I shoulda done it four strips ago, but I just got a new job and the depression's only starting to wear off, leave me alone.

name: professorhazard
text: There there, Doctor.

name: chuvak
text: At least you're still wasting time at work reading web comics. Or, rather, taking time out of your busy web comic reading schedule to work in a little work.

name: lost_buoy
text: He's worked it into the Excel spreadsheet.

name: sharpdresseddan
text:
Agent: Okay Mr. Smuckles, your round-trip ticket and lodgings come to only five hundred dollars!
Ray: Yo, toss another hundo on to that price...I have my reasons.

name: susurrus
text: i find it strange that a bunch of cats call eachother dogg.

name: goocifer
text: I just wish there was a martini balanced on top of the oil lamp...

name: lost_buoy
text:
Nah, he's on an English moor. He's got a carafe of claret decanted by the ghost of Charlotte Bronte.

(n.b. - I ain't even gonna attempt the umlaut, Assetbar, so bite me.)

name: cailetshadow
text:
It's been awhile since I've had the stamina, but I read through all the comments on AssetBar. I feel like an old man who is watching the world speed up, cheapen and degenerate before his eyes. 75% of the comments here are not about the comic itself anymore. And most of the others don't seem to get the joke.

(Ray has decided, ridiculously enough, to make amends to Beef by moving to a remote cottage in England. It is funny because what he has actually done is leave Beef with all of Ray's chores, ie paying the bills and returning movies. He has also informed beef that the house will soon start to smell like rotting fish, and that Beef's power is about to be cut off and there's nothing he can do about it. It is funny. Please, please get it. Onstad is not slipping. You are slipping.)

I miss the good old days, AssetBar used to feel more like Cheers. I miss Flynn; that guy rocked. I even miss the reliable sight of 30aught lames underneath Asherdan's posts.

Goodbye, AssetBar. You are no longer helping me love Achewood.

name: falseprophet
text: Goodbye, Leon Soom-beh-cheh.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Oh come on now, the thing ain't even a year old hardly and people are pining for the early days.

I REMEMBER WHEN THERE WERE ONLY 3468 MEMBERS NOT 9786..OK SO HALF OF THOSE ARE DIFFERENT NAMES POING USES BUT SO WHAT AM I RIGHT

but seriously Later D.O.G.G.

name: catgrl131
text: Well, yes. Believe it or not, sometimes we like to talk about things other that Achewood !

name: catgrl131
text: SHITMEISTER! * than

name: drskradley
text:
Shitmeister , n.

German, lit. "master of shit"

name: professorhazard
text: Wouldn't that be scheissemeister , perhaps more accurately portmanteau-ed into scheisster , a homophone for "shyster", AKA the common attorney?

name: drskradley
text:
Perhaps, fucker.

Splittin' hairs about my code-switching Anglo-Germanic tendencies...

name: drskradley
text: Man, that ain't meant to be as aggressive as it sounded.  We cool, we cool.

name: professorhazard
text: Ain't I been a good Acheworld peer to ya, Doc?

name: drskradley
text: It's all good baby.  You know we wuz juzt spittin' the shiznitt.

name: rowboat
text:
Quote:
Goodbye, AssetBar.

But if you leave, who'll explain to us what was funny about the comic?

Look, I'm sure you're proud about being one of the "early adopters," but face it - the old boards you pine for were kind of really a bore. There would be thirteen comments and seven of them would be people just repeating a line from the strip. Deimosrising was considered to be the class of the league back then. If that same guy had just now signed-up and went back and said those same things, he'd be ignored. I'm not tryin' to be mean, it's just that the bar has been raised. Yes, there are a lot of junk posters. But look past them and see the quality intellect we got goin' around here, these days. We have a hell of a lot of rad people here, now, and almost all of them help me love Achewood in one way or another.

Anyway, you're welcome to join the new school, but you have to stop dissin' us, first.

name: drskradley
text: It's evolution, baby.

name: farqussus
text: Who are you?

name: fineoakstructure
text:
That's a little rude. The guy does have a lot of chubbies and few lames, and posted quite a bit in the "early days" of assetbar.

Would you be surprised to learn, though, that he hasn't left assetbar? I saw one or two posts by him while going through the archives from the last few weeks.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
he is no longer found.

Google still comes up with results, but they dwindle.

name: fineoakstructure
text: He was still around a few months ago, at least; we had a short conversation on some strip in the archives where I joked on him about this whole thing.

name: sprayette
text: Ray is the only other sentient being I know of who handwrites in all caps.
